meanings.definition: The sale of goods to the public in relatively small quantities for use or consumption rather than for resale.
meanings.sent1: At the retail store, customers can buy small amounts of products for personal use.
meanings.sent2: I prefer shopping at retail outlets because I can purchase items in small quantities.
meanings.sent3: The retail shop had a sale, so I bought just a few items to treat myself.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a retail therapy session, bringing joy in small doses.
meanings.sent5: The colorful display at the retail shop made the products look irresistible.

meanings.definition: To sell in small quantities directly to the ultimate consumer.
meanings.sent1: She decided to retail her handmade jewelry at local craft fairs.
meanings.sent2: The farmer chose to retail his fresh produce at the neighborhood market.
meanings.sent3: I will retail my baked goods at the school fundraiser to raise money.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling ability allowed him to retail his books successfully to readers.
meanings.sent5: The artist plans to retail her paintings online to reach a wider audience.
